p: The concoctions traditionally used in treatment of malaria in Papua Island are composed of several types of plant parts. Based on the PPV results, majority of people, put at 44.38%, used leaves in Papua as their ingredients for traditional treatment of malaria. This was followed by the bark at 20.12%, stem at 10.06%, roots at 6.51%, herbs at 4.73%, whole plant at 4.14%, and seeds at 2.37%. In addition, each of fruit, rhizome, and exudate at 1.78%, tubers at 1.18%, and each of flower and fresh fruit at 0.59%, as shown in FigureÂ 4.
